comment: - Water quality observed schema adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.WaterQuality/master/WaterQualityObserved/schema.json
description: Water Quality data model is intended to represent water quality parameters at a certain water mass (river,  lake, sea, etc.) section

contents.name: Chla
contents.comment: Concentration of chlorophyll A.

contents.name: Cl-
contents.comment: Concentration of chlorides.

contents.name: NH3
contents.comment: Concentration of ammonia.

contents.name: NH4
contents.comment: Concentration of ammonium.

contents.name: NO3
contents.comment: Concentration of nitrates.

contents.name: O2
contents.comment: Level of free, non-compound oxygen present.

contents.name: PC
contents.comment: Concentration of pigment phycocyanin which can be measured to estimate cyanobacteria concentrations specifically.

contents.name: PE
contents.comment: Concentration of pigment phycoerythrin which can be measured to estimate cyanobacteria concentrations specifically.

contents.name: PO4
contents.comment: Concentration of phosphates.

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: bod
contents.comment: Biochemical oxygen demand (BOD) is the amount of dissolved oxygen (DO) needed (i.e. demanded) by aerobic biological organisms to break down organic material present in a given water sample at certain temperature over a specific time period

contents.name: cod
contents.comment: Chemical oxygen demand (COD) is an indicative measure of the amount of oxygen that can be consumed by reactions in a measured solution

contents.name: conductance
contents.comment: Specific Conductance.

contents.name: conductivity
contents.comment: Electrical Conductivity.

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateObserved
contents.comment: The date and time of this observation in ISO8601 UTCformat. It can be represented by an specific time instant or by an ISO8601 interval.

contents.name: description
contents.comment: A description of this item

contents.name: enterococci
contents.comment: Concentration of Enterococci

contents.name: escherichiaColi
contents.comment: Concentration of Escherichia coli

contents.name: name
contents.comment: The name of this item.

contents.name: orp
contents.comment: Oxidation-Reduction potential.

contents.name: pH
contents.comment: Acidity or basicity of an aqueous solution.

contents.name: salinity
contents.comment: Amount of salts dissolved in water.

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: tds
contents.comment: Total dissolved solids.

contents.name: temperature
contents.comment: Temperature

contents.name: tss
contents.comment: Total suspended solids.

contents.name: turbidity
contents.comment: Amount of light scattered by particles in the water column

contents.name: measurand
contents.comment: An array of strings containing details (see format below) about extra measurands provided by this observation.

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)

contents.name: address
contents.comment: The mailing address
